Package hecc_up

Class HeccParser

java.lang.Object
hecc_up.HeccParser
public class HeccParser extends Object
This parses the full HECC code bottom text

  • Constructor Details

    • HeccParser

      public HeccParser​(String rawHeccData, LoggerInterface boundary)
      Creates the HeccParser object
      Parameters:
      rawHeccData - the raw hecc data that needs passing
      boundary - the implementation of LoggerInterface that this logs important info to

  • Method Details

    • constructThePassageObjects

      public boolean constructThePassageObjects() throws NoPassagesException, DuplicatePassageNameException, EmptyPassageException, DeletedLinkPresentException
      This is responsible for setting up the metadata, passageNames, and passageMap objects
      Returns:
      true if this is executed successfully
      Throws:
      NoPassagesException - if there are no passages defined
      DuplicatePassageNameException - if two passages have the same name
      EmptyPassageException - if there's an empty passage
      DeletedLinkPresentException - if the passage contains a link to a deleted passage

    • makeMetadataObject

      private String makeMetadataObject​(String dataToParse)
      This method basically constructs the Metadata object
      Parameters:
      dataToParse - the full hecc data being parsed
      Returns:
      all the hecc data from the first passage declaration. The metadata object is made as an attribute of this class.

    • findPassageNames

      private Set<String> findPassageNames​(String dataToParse) throws DuplicatePassageNameException, NoPassagesException
      Attempts to find the names of all the passages in the raw hecc data
      Parameters:
      dataToParse - the raw hecc data being parsed
      Returns:
      a Set of all the String passage names
      Throws:
      DuplicatePassageNameException - if multiple passages share the same name
      NoPassagesException - if no passages exist

    • constructPassageMap

      private Map<String,​PassageOutputtingInterface> constructPassageMap​(String dataToParse) throws EmptyPassageException, DeletedLinkPresentException
      This method constructs the passage map
      Parameters:
      dataToParse - the raw hecc data being parsed
      Returns:
      A map of the passage objects declared in the raw data
      Throws:
      EmptyPassageException - if a passage is empty
      DeletedLinkPresentException - if the passage contains a link to a deleted passage

    • validatePassages

      public boolean validatePassages() throws UndefinedPassageException, MissingStartingPassageException
      A method that can be used to ensure that the passage names are all valid and such
      Returns:
      true if all passages are valid, false if there's a problem
      Throws:
      UndefinedPassageException - if a passage has a link to a passage which doesn't exist
      MissingStartingPassageException - if the defined starting passage doesn't exist

    • prepareHeccedData

      public boolean prepareHeccedData() throws UndefinedPassageException, MissingStartingPassageException
      This prepares the heccedData ArrayList, using the Metadata object and the passageMap map
      Returns:
      true if this was performed successfully
      Throws:
      UndefinedPassageException - if there's an undefined passage somewhere
      MissingStartingPassageException - if the specified starting passage doesn't exist

    • outputAllNonOrphanPassages

      private List<String> outputAllNonOrphanPassages​(String startPassage) throws UndefinedPassageException
      Obtains a list containing the hecced data of all the passages that are linked to the start passage, depth-first non-recursive search
      Parameters:
      startPassage - name of the start passage
      Returns:
      the set of all the PassageOutputtingLinkCheckingInterface objects that are reachable from the Start passage
      Throws:
      UndefinedPassageException - if a passage fails a validity check

    • getNamesOfAllNonOrphanPassages

      @Deprecated private Set<String> getNamesOfAllNonOrphanPassages​(Set<String> knownLinked, String currentPassageName) throws UndefinedPassageException, StackOverflowError
      Deprecated.
      use outputAllNonOrphanPassages instead, it's not recursive, outputs the hecced data, much better.
      This method is used to get the names of all non-orphan passages, recursively.
      Parameters:
      knownLinked - a set with the names of all known passages that are linked together.
      currentPassageName - the name of the current passageOutputtingInterface object that is being looked at. If this passage name is already in knownLinked, it's skipped. If it links to a passage which is already in knownLinked, that passage is skipped (so we don't get any overflows).
      Returns:
      a set with the names of all passages that are linked together.
      Throws:
      UndefinedPassageException - if there's a problem with the current passage.
      StackOverflowError - because recursion do be like that sometimes
      See Also:
      outputAllNonOrphanPassages

    • getMetadata

      public Metadata getMetadata()
      Obtains the Metadata object
      Returns:
      the Metadata object

    • getHeccedData

      public List<String> getHeccedData()
      Obtains the heccedData list
      Returns:
      the heccedData list

    • printPassageObjects

      public void printPassageObjects()
      Prints the Passage objects in the passageMap for debugging reasons
